growerp.course.Course.title: How to Create a Course with GrowERP: The Curriculum
growerp.course.Course.description: This curriculum outlines the process of building, validating, and selling a course using the GrowERP ecosystem. It combines industry best practices with the specific tools and strategies found in the GrowERP architecture (Assessments, Landing Pages, and Outreach).
growerp.course.Course.objectives: To take a course creator from "Idea" to "Automated Sales Funnel" using GrowERP.

growerp.course.CourseModule.title: Strategy & Validation (The "Why")
growerp.course.CourseModule.description: Based on "GrowERP Course Media Strategy.md" and "Marketing hooks.md"

growerp.course.CourseLesson.title: Identifying the Pain Point
growerp.course.CourseLesson.content: * **Objective**: Define a specific problem your course solves. * **Case Study**: The **Field Service Efficiency Masterclass**. * *Bad*: "A course about inventory software." * *Good*: "Your HVAC fleet is losing $500 per van every week. Hereâ€™s how to stop it." * **Action Project**: Write 3 "Agitator" hooks for your course topic.

growerp.course.CourseLesson.title: The "Why-What-How" Framework
growerp.course.CourseLesson.content: * **Objective**: Structure your value proposition. * **Why**: Why does this problem exist? (e.g., "Manual inventory tracking") * **What**: What is the solution? (e.g., "Real-time Van Warehouses") * **How**: How do we implement it? (The Course Content). * **Ref**: Solopreneur Mini-Course Strategy.

growerp.course.CourseLesson.title: Why Assessments Beat Standard Opt-ins
growerp.course.CourseLesson.content: * **Theory**: People love learning about themselves. An "Effective Score" is more compelling than a "Newsletter Signup". * **Strategy**: Use the assessment to qualify leads *before* they buy.

growerp.course.CourseLesson.title: Building the Assessment in XML
growerp.course.CourseLesson.content: * **Technical Skill**: Defining `growerp.assessment.Assessment`. * **Key Components**: * `AssessmentQuestion`: The input (e.g., "How do you track inventory?"). * `AssessmentQuestionOption`: Scored answers (Score 1 for "Paper", Score 10 for "ERP"). * `ScoringThreshold`: Determining user status (Hot vs. Warm lead). * **Example Code Review**: Analyzing the `FS_EFFICIENCY` assessment structure.

growerp.course.CourseModule.title: Curriculum Design & Content
growerp.course.CourseModule.description: Based on Digital Product Best Practices

growerp.course.CourseLesson.title: Structuring for Success
growerp.course.CourseLesson.content: * **Rule of Thumb**: 3-5 Modules per Course. * **Lesson Structure**: 1. **The Concept** (Video/Text). 2. **The Example** (Real-world scenario). 3. **The Action Item** (Implementation). * **Ref**: "8 Steps to Your First Mini-Course.md".

growerp.course.CourseLesson.title: Production Formats
growerp.course.CourseLesson.content: * **Video**: Keep under 6 minutes (Micro-learning). * **Text/Guide**: For referencing complex configurations. * **Quizzes**: Reinforce learning (GrowERP supports `Assessment` types for quizzes too).

growerp.course.CourseModule.title: The Launch Funnel & Automation
growerp.course.CourseModule.description: Based on Landing Pages and Marketing Service definitions

growerp.course.CourseLesson.title: The Landing Page
growerp.course.CourseLesson.content: * **Technical Skill**: Defining `growerp.landing.LandingPage`. * **Components**: * `hookType`: "ResultsHook" vs "StoryHook". * `ctaAssessmentId`: Linking your Assessment from Module 2. * `headline`: The primary promise. * **Example**: Analyzing `B2B_LANDING` ("Scale Your Sales Team Without Scaling Your Software Bill").

growerp.course.CourseLesson.title: Automated Outreach
growerp.course.CourseLesson.content: * **Strategy**: Using `OutreachServices` to follow up. * **Sequence**: 1. **Hot Lead (Heigh Score)**: Direct personal email/call. 2. **Warm Lead (Medium Score)**: Nurture sequence (Case Studies). * **Ref**: "20 emails to persuade people to buy.md".

growerp.course.CourseLesson.title: Build Your Prototype
growerp.course.CourseLesson.content: **Build Your Prototype**: 1. Define your **Hook**. 2. Write a simple 5-question **Assessment** in XML. 3. Create a **Landing Page** entry linking to it. 4. Outline your **Course Modules**.
